intro: Rathbunia eruca, commonly known as the common rathbunia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, alternate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Rathbunia eruca is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
